meanings.definition: A small switch operated by a very slight movement, used in electronic devices.
meanings.sent1: The microswitch on the remote control makes it easy to change channels with a gentle press.
meanings.sent2: I need to replace the microswitch on my computer mouse because it's not clicking properly.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat kept pawing at the microswitch on the toy, thinking it was a tiny bug to catch.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to leave the company was like flicking a microswitch, changing the entire dynamic of the team.
meanings.sent5: The scientist explained how the microswitch functions in a way that even a child could understand.

meanings.definition: To activate or deactivate by means of a microswitch.
meanings.sent1: He will microswitch the alarm system before leaving the house for added security.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to microswitch the power button to turn off the device completely.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to microswitch the lights on and off with a wave of his hand, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to microswitch his mood from gloomy to cheerful in an instant.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic expertly microswitched the engine, bringing the old car back to life.
